revised_title: Nonlinear Theory of Centrifugal Instabilities in Finite Cylinders
tldr: This article investigates the nonlinear development of unstable disturbances in circumferential flows within finite cylinders, focusing on the effect of end walls on fluid motions. The study finds that the bifurcation of Taylor vortex flow in finite cylinders is two-sided, and the interaction of the two most dangerous modes of linear theory is explored. The results provide insights into the behavior of fluid dynamics in finite systems and have implications for understanding and controlling instabilities in engineering and industrial applications.
